snippet: Only 14 percent of the men traveling second-class on the Titanic survived. A grandson of one of them is left to wonder what helped him beat the odds.
abstract: Nicholas Wade essay speculates on how Lawrence Beesley, his grandfather, survived the sinking of the Titanic in an era when 'women and children first' was a moral code stronger than law; only 14 percent of male second-class passengers survived the wreck, while 86 percent of their companion female travelers were rescued.
lead_paragraph: Only 14 percent of the men traveling second-class on the Titanic survived. A grandson of one of them is left to wonder what helped him beat the odds.

headline.seo: Beating the Odds to Survive the Titanic’s Sinking
headline.main: As Hundreds of Men Perished, One Ignored a Rumor to Survive
headline.print_headline: As Hundreds of Men Perished, One Ignored a Rumor to Survive
